content:
• Wednesday, March 7, 2012
  • KTOS

    More on Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS): Q4 misses slightly on revenue but...

    More on Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS): Q4 misses slightly on revenue but easily beats on a per share basis. Net profit actually swung to a loss as higher amortization and overhead expenses weighed on bottom-line results. Shares are up after hours however, as the company issues an upbeat forecast for FY12. It now expects revenue to be around $950M - $1B, above Street estimates of $939M. Shares +10.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 PM
  • KFY

    Korn/Ferry (NYSE:KFY) FQ3 beats on revenue but misses on a per share basis. Net profit fell 16%...

    Korn/Ferry (NYSE:KFY) FQ3 beats on revenue but misses on a per share basis. Net profit fell 16% as the staffing firm's revenue from fees continues to lose momentum. The company also issues a cautious outlook for the current-quarter, now projecting to earn between $0.24 - $0.30, falling short of consensus estimates of $0.31. Shares -3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM
  • SIGM

    More on Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM): Q4 misses on both revenue and EPS on wider-than-expected...

    More on Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM): Q4 misses on both revenue and EPS on wider-than-expected losses. Revenue collapsed 49% Y/Y as competitive pricing on newer products continued to hurt its top line. Shares -5.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM
  • ALXA

    Shares of Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) jump after hours as Grupo Ferrer agrees to buy...

    Shares of Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) jump after hours as Grupo Ferrer agrees to buy 2.4M shares of Alexza stock at $1.24 per share, more than double the pharmaceutical company's $0.60 closing price. Shares +15% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM
  • ALKS

    Alkermes (NASDAQ:ALKS) -3.9% AH after announcing Elan (NYSE:ELN) plans to sell 13.9M shares...

    Alkermes (NASDAQ:ALKS) -3.9% AH after announcing Elan (NYSE:ELN) plans to sell 13.9M shares through a secondary offering. Elan obtained a 25% stake in Alkermes as part of the latter's acquisition of the former's drug manufacturing business.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • DTG

    Shares of rental car companies posted strong gains after MKM Partners pegs Dollar Thrifty...

    Shares of rental car companies posted strong gains after MKM Partners pegs Dollar Thrifty (DTG +3%) as "best positioned" to benefit from strong residual values due to its high mix of owned-outright vehicles and of compact and midsize vehicles. But Avis (CAR +5.5%) and Hertz (HTZ +6%) also gain on MKM's belief that used-car prices will be supported by higher new-car prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • PLL-OLD

    More on Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD): FQ2 misses on all counts despite an 8.2% Y/Y rise in revenue...

    More on Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD): FQ2 misses on all counts despite an 8.2% Y/Y rise in revenue growth. Sales increased across all segments, with good growth in its Life Sciences and Industrial units. On a global basis, emerging market sales grew over 20% in local currency driven by the Energy markets in MENA and Latin America. Shares -1.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • CCI

    Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI) +5.2% AH after it's reported the mobile tower operator will replace...

    Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI) +5.2% AH after it's reported the mobile tower operator will replace Constellation Energy (NYSE:CEG) in the S&P 500. Constellation is set to be acquired by Exelon.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • SMTC

    More on Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC): Q4 beats slightly on both revenue and EPS, but guides Q1 lower...

    More on Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC): Q4 beats slightly on both revenue and EPS, but guides Q1 lower due to anticipated flat margins and higher SG&A expenses. The company now expects sales in the range of $102M - $108M, below the Street view of $113M. Q1 EPS are seen in the range of $0.28 - $0.32, versus expectations of $0.36 per share. Shares -2.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • GLW

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) edges higher AH after it's disclosed director Gordon Gund bought 150K shares...

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) edges higher AH after it's disclosed director Gordon Gund bought 150K shares on March 6 at $12.75. Gund last bought Corning shares in Nov. 2008.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 5 Comments
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM): Q4 EPS of -$0.22 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $15.5M (+12.3% Y/Y)...

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM): Q4 EPS of -$0.22 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $15.5M (+12.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • FTK

    More on Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q4 solidly beats across-the-board. Profit grew 57% Y/Y,...

    More on Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q4 solidly beats across-the-board. Profit grew 57% Y/Y, driven by revenue growth in its Chemicals and Logistics and Drilling Products segments through improved pricing, increased drilling activity and aggressive marketing efforts that boosted market share. Shares +5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • BMY

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN) -4.8% AH after announcing a  13M share stock offering. The...

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN) -4.8% AH after announcing a  13M share stock offering. The drug developer says it will use the proceeds to help commercialize its recently-approved Bydureon diabetes drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • JCP

    Macy's (JCP +3.2%) sees opportunity for itself and other retailers from disruptions at J.C....

    Macy's (JCP +3.2%) sees opportunity for itself and other retailers from disruptions at J.C. Penney (JCP +0.8%) as the retailer revamps operations. "It's going to be a tough year [for JCP], so I do see opportunity short-term... long-term as well," Macy's CFO Karen Hoguet says. JCP's latest hurdle: S&P lowers its credit rating to BB, one step deeper into junk territory.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • FTK

    Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q4 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $74.9M (+57.7% Y/Y)...

    Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q4 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $74.9M (+57.7% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • AMAG

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) +6.8% AH after announcing positive preliminary results for...

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) +6.8% AH after announcing positive preliminary results for the first of 2 Phase III studies for its Feraheme drug. The results suggests Feraheme could be effective in treating iron deficiency regardless of its cause, rather than simply for kidney disease. AMAG plans to submit a supplemental NDA to the FDA that would allow it to expand Feraheme's addressable market.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • HOTT

    Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q4 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $210M (-1.2% Y/Y) in-line....

    Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q4 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $210M (-1.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CF

    Morgan Stanley says to buy CF Industries (CF +4%) on recent weakness following two days of...

    Morgan Stanley says to buy CF Industries (CF +4%) on recent weakness following two days of investor meetings. The firm thinks valuations are compelling and expects the company to use its hoard of cash for large share repurchases.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +4.4%) enjoys an upgrade to Neutral from Underperform by BofA on expectations the...

    Tesoro (TSO +4.4%) enjoys an upgrade to Neutral from Underperform by BofA on expectations the refiner's shares will benefit this summer from tighter gasoline crack spreads and increased disclosure about planned projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • TNS

    TNS (TNS +15.6%) shares soar after issuing full-year and Q1 guidance that top analyst consensus....

    TNS (TNS +15.6%) shares soar after issuing full-year and Q1 guidance that top analyst consensus. The data communications company swung to a Q4 profit as revenue improved and a higher tax provision weighed on year-ago results. TNS also says COO Mike Keegan would take on the added role of president.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM +3%) could replace Texas Instruments (TXN +1.5%) as the combo chip supplier for...

    Broadcom (BRCM +3%) could replace Texas Instruments (TXN +1.5%) as the combo chip supplier for the next generation of Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle Fire, Lazard says, estimating the design win could add $30M to BRCM's 2012 revenue and better position it in the tablet market. The firm also says BRCM is well positioned to maintain the combo chip business for Apple's latest iPad.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • AAPL

    Its stock diving on the apparent bad news from the Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) conference, Netflix...

    Its stock diving on the apparent bad news from the Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) conference, Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) takes to its blog, VP Bill Holmes saying customers can sign up for the service from their Apple TV and pay via their iTunes account. Thanks to Apple, the picture and audio promises to be improved as well. Down 4% minutes ago, shares now off 2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • LOW

    February's ADP employment report showed small-business hires again drove most of job growth, and...

    February's ADP employment report showed small-business hires again drove most of job growth, and the opportunity isn't lost on some companies. Lowe's (LOW +3.9%) unveils a partnership with Deluxe Corp. (DLX +0.7%) to offer marketing and paperwork outsourcing to the small contractors that shop its home improvement warehouses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has decided to keep the 16GB versions of the iPad 2 around at price points...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has decided to keep the 16GB versions of the iPad 2 around at price points of $399 (Wi-Fi only) and $529 (Wi-Fi/3G). The price cuts stand to make life even more difficult for rival high-end tablet vendors, which in turn could spell trouble for chip suppliers such as NVDA, ATML, and CY. However, Barnes & Noble (BKS +4.8%), whose Nook Tablet goes for $199-$249, is actually spiking higher. Amazon (AMZN +1.5%) is largely unchanged. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • AKRX

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Akorn's (AKRX -6.2%), Q3 report, saying that   guidance for 2012...

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Akorn's (AKRX -6.2%), Q3 report, saying that   guidance for 2012 looks conservative and earnings growth should be compelling with the relaunch of up to 20 generic products. The firm reiterates its Overweight rating with a $14 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • RHI

    Robert Half International (RHI +2.3%) catches a bid after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and $34...

    Robert Half International (RHI +2.3%) catches a bid after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and $34 PT. The firm expects Robert Half to benefit from both a cyclical recovery in temp staffing, and growing long-term demand for labor cost flexibility. It also thinks growing demand for skilled IT professionals could give the company a lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • IMMR

    In spite of rumors to the contrary, pricing for new iPad models will be on par with that for...

    In spite of rumors to the contrary, pricing for new iPad models will be on par with that for similar iPad 2 models. Immersion (IMMR -3.7%) and OmniVision (OVTI -0.8%) have given up their early gains. Haptic feedback support hasn't yet been announced, and there may be fears that the similarities between the cameras used in the new iPad and the iPhone 4S indicate a Sony sensor is being used. Apple (AAPL -0.1%) is off slightly. (live blog)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • EXPR

    Express (EXPR +3.7%) moves up after its Q4 beat estimates earlier today. Earnings rose 25% as...

    Express (EXPR +3.7%) moves up after its Q4 beat estimates earlier today. Earnings rose 25% as the apparel retailer reported stronger sales and margins despite a highly promotional holiday season

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CCIH

    ChinaCache International (CCIH -14.3%) tanks after missing on its Q4 EPS estimate due to margin...

    ChinaCache International (CCIH -14.3%) tanks after missing on its Q4 EPS estimate due to margin pressures and higher operating expenses. Additionally, Q1 revenue guidance points to a slowdown in growth and further pressure on its bottom line. Separately, both Pacific Crest and BofA Merrill Lynch downgrade the shares to Sector Perform and Neutral respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -0.8%) gives up big early gains and turns red as Tim Cook says iCloud - with 100M...

    Netflix (NFLX -0.8%) gives up big early gains and turns red as Tim Cook says iCloud - with 100M customers - now supports movies that can be downloaded to any Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) device.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • AKRX

    Akorn (AKRX +6.5%) gets a lift from Needham with a maintained Buy rating and $1 price target...

    Akorn (AKRX +6.5%) gets a lift from Needham with a maintained Buy rating and $1 price target increase to $14. Analysts call for a year of outperformance for shares off the strength of its pipeline and a revenue boost from recent acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • MLCO

    Gaming company stocks (BJK +2.1%) rally - helped in part by positive sentiment stirred up by...

    Gaming company stocks (BJK +2.1%) rally - helped in part by positive sentiment stirred up by gambling revenue data from Macau and the big boost in revenue that Shuffle Master saw from its electronic-gaming segment. Gainers: MPEL +6.5%, MGM +4.2%, BYD +3.8%, WYNN +2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR +10.5%) is spiking higher following reports the next iPad will feature advanced...

    Immersion (IMMR +10.5%) is spiking higher following reports the next iPad will feature advanced haptic feedback technology from rival Senseg. Apple's big event starts at 1PM ET (live blog).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • WWE

    World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE -1.1%) dips after Roth Capital cut the shares downgraded to...

    World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE -1.1%) dips after Roth Capital cut the shares downgraded to Neutral on the back of its the lower-than-expected Q4 report and expected weakness post-Wrestlemania when The Rock's storyline ends April 1. The firm also lowers its price target to $10 from $13.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • JNY

    The Jones Group (JNY +3.1%) and J.C. Penney (JCP +1.5%) trade higher after the firms disclose...

    The Jones Group (JNY +3.1%) and J.C. Penney (JCP +1.5%) trade higher after the firms disclose that they are in discussions on a number of initiatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Two downgrades for Pandora (P -23.2%) after its big Q4 miss. Raymond James cuts its rating to...

    Two downgrades for Pandora (P -23.2%) after its big Q4 miss. Raymond James cuts its rating to Market Perform, expecting shares to be range-bound until seeing "greater traction with mobile monetization... and improved operating margins." Citi cuts shares to Neutral and drops its price target to $17 from $25, slamming "no profitability track record and no near-term profitable outlook."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +4.7%) trades up after showing an improvement in Q4 revenue,...

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +4.7%) trades up after showing an improvement in Q4 revenue, despite around $20M in store impairment charges. Earnings reached the high end of company guidance and the company also forecasted an improvement in sales in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • DECK

    Insiders including the CEO have been selling shares at footwear purveyor Deckers Outdoor (DECK...

    Insiders including the CEO have been selling shares at footwear purveyor Deckers Outdoor (DECK -5.7%), according to SEC filings. Shares hit a new 52-week low.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 10 Comments
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (AVAV -2.8%) fades after missing on its FQ3 results late yesterday. Earnings fell...

    AeroVironment (AVAV -2.8%) fades after missing on its FQ3 results late yesterday. Earnings fell 50% as the unmanned-aircraft manufacturer reported sharply lower revenue due to delivery delays.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • WINT

    Discovery Labs (DSCO +17.9%) could be acquired, speculates Roth Capital. Following the approval...

    Discovery Labs (DSCO +17.9%) could be acquired, speculates Roth Capital. Following the approval of its synthetic surfactant, Surfaxin, by the FDA, Roth says the company could sell itself, or obtain a partner. It raises its target on the shares to $10 from $6 while maintaining its Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 3 Comments

  • Microcap Liquidmetal Technologies (LQMT) skyrockets 75.5% on reports (I, II) that the firm's...

    Microcap Liquidmetal Technologies (LQMT) skyrockets 75.5% on reports (I, II) that the firm's announcement that it shipped commercial parts to unnamed customers is related to the use of liquid metal in the iPad 3.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ -10.1%) is tanking following a weak Q4 report. Not helping matters is the...

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ -10.1%) is tanking following a weak Q4 report. Not helping matters is the company's guidance for Q1 module shipments of 340MW-350MW, down sharply from Q4's 436MW. Canadian does expect its full-year shipments to reach 1.8GW-2GW (up from 2011's 1.32GW), but given the solar industry's current state of affairs, the Street might be skeptical about its ability to hit that target.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • CAL

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS -10.1%) sink after the company misfires with its Q4 results, impacted...

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS -10.1%) sink after the company misfires with its Q4 results, impacted by declining sales (Y/Y) in its Famous Footwear and Specialty Retail segments. The company says that it's "planning cautiously" for 2012 and expects full-year EPS of $0.78-$0.92.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM

  • European shares and the euro race back to the day's highs on the Greek debt swap news as the...

    European shares and the euro race back to the day's highs on the Greek debt swap news as the deal looks to be on they way to climbing past the key 66% level. Participation below that point could have scuttled the PSI and the bailout with it, leading to some sort of disorderly default. Stoxx 50 +0.6%, euro +0.3%. U.S. shares rise in tandem, S&P 500 +0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +2.1%) gains after being upgraded to Add at Capital One, based on the...

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +2.1%) gains after being upgraded to Add at Capital One, based on the increased value of its 80K net acreage position in the Tuscaloosa Marine Shale. Ther firm also raises its price target to $20 from $18.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -5.1%) is this morning's worst S&P performer on reports of an SEC...

    First Solar (FSLR -5.1%) is this morning's worst S&P performer on reports of an SEC investigation into the failed Topaz Solar Farm project and as questions mount about its fundamental viability. FSLR reportedly is cutting production at its operations in Germany and Malaysia, delaying the opening of a plant in Arizona, and will not open a planned facility in Vietnam.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +1.2%) is moving up on chatter that Blackstone may invest $700 - 800M in the...

    Molycorp (MCP +1.2%) is moving up on chatter that Blackstone may invest $700 - 800M in the company, which could bring a 20 - 30% deal premium.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO +5.2%) CEO Bill Klesse predicts new supplies of crude oil from Canada and the...

    Valero Energy (VLO +5.2%) CEO Bill Klesse predicts new supplies of crude oil from Canada and the American mid-continent will allow Gulf Coast refineries to expand exports of gasoline and diesel as North America lowers its dependence on offshore oil, Canada's Globe and Mail reports. VLO is a key customer for TransCanada’s (NYSE:TRP) Keystone pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -2.8%) is selling off, and the culprit might be a deal between American Express...

    Groupon (GRPN -2.8%) is selling off, and the culprit might be a deal between American Express (NYSE:AXP) and Twitter. The deal allows AmEx cardholders with Twitter accounts to have retail discounts automatically loaded onto their cards after making tweets with specific hashtags. Initial partners for the program include Best Buy, McDonald's, and Whole Foods. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (FFIV +2.9%) gains on positive comments out of ThinkEquity this morning, saying the...

    F5 Networks (FFIV +2.9%) gains on positive comments out of ThinkEquity this morning, saying the recent weakness in the stock creates a buying opportunity. The firm notes that after conducting channel checks, it believes momentum is accelerating.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • P

    Though Pandora (P -22.3%) is crashing following a dismal FQ4 report (I, II), Wells Fargo and...

    Though Pandora (P -22.3%) is crashing following a dismal FQ4 report (I, II), Wells Fargo and Needham are staying positive. The former touts Pandora's emergence as mobile music heavyweight, while the latter notes the company's strong market share and automotive potential. Less positive is Dougherty, which thinks mobile monetization will remain a problem until sales and technology shortcomings are addressed. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • HOV

    Shares of homebuilder Hovnanian (HOV +2.5%) rise after reporting an after-tax loss well below a...

    Shares of homebuilder Hovnanian (HOV +2.5%) rise after reporting an after-tax loss well below a year ago, and revenue increased nearly 7%. Contract backlog at the end of January totaled 1,730 homes with a sales value of $578.4M, Y/Y increases of 28% and 33% respectively. Other homebuilders rise too: DHI +2.7%, LEN +3.1%, KBH +3.1%, PHM +2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • EVRI

    Shares of Global Cash Access Holdings (GCA +13.7%) go on a run after the company knocks out a Q4...

    Shares of Global Cash Access Holdings (GCA +13.7%) go on a run after the company knocks out a Q4 earnings beat. The company says it benefited from the enactment of the Durbin Amendment and the impact from the legislation on the interchange rates paid on its debit transactions.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • ZION

    Zions Bancorp (ZION +2%) leads financial sector gainers as it benefits from a Buy rating at Roth...

    Zions Bancorp (ZION +2%) leads financial sector gainers as it benefits from a Buy rating at Roth Capital. "In our view, the company's earnings volatility and capital structure have overshadowed improving trends and core earnings power, resulting in a discounted valuation," Roth says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lulelemom (LULU +3.5%) kick up a gain after Credit Suisse ups its rating to Outperform...

    Shares of Lulelemom (LULU +3.5%) kick up a gain after Credit Suisse ups its rating to Outperform from Neutral and boosts its price target on shares by $20 to $78.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) +2.8% after announcing its acquisition of Transcend Services (TRCR +39.6%),...

    Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) +2.8% after announcing its acquisition of Transcend Services (TRCR +39.6%), a provider of medical transcription and speech editing services. Nuance claims the all-cash deal will add $140M-$150M to FY13 revenue, and $0.08-$0.09 to EPS. Transcend's offerings, which are focused on small and mid-sized hospitals, will complement Nuance's existing voice recognition solutions for the healthcare market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • HOV

    Hovnanian (NYSE:HOV): FQ1 EPS of -$0.17 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $270M (+6.7% Y/Y) misses by...

    Hovnanian (NYSE:HOV): FQ1 EPS of -$0.17 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $270M (+6.7% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares +4.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • SLTM

    Solta Medical (NASDAQ:SLTM) +5.8% premarket after providing an update of the launch of its...

    Solta Medical (NASDAQ:SLTM) +5.8% premarket after providing an update of the launch of its FDA-approved Liposonix non-invasive fat reduction system. SLTM says it is on track to meet or exceed 2012 revenue guidance, and the majority of key opinion leaders who received Liposonix systems have successfully evaluated and purchased the product.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures retain their gains after the ADP jobs report hits the right...

    Market preview: Stock futures retain their gains after the ADP jobs report hits the right buttons and buyers re-enter the market following the worst single-session loss in nearly three months yesterday. That Greece could be heading for default is neither here nor there for the timebeing. S&P benchmark futures +0.5%. Pandora -25.6% after a bad earnings report. Later: Consumer Credit, iPad 3 frenzy
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CIEN

    Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) +8.7% premarket despite reporting FQ1 revenue below consensus and a...

    Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) +8.7% premarket despite reporting FQ1 revenue below consensus and a deeper-than-expected net loss. Gross margin improved to 40.3% from 38.9%, and operating expenses sank 18%. CEO Gary Smith says FQ1 did not “reflect the underlying strength of the business and ongoing customer demand," and results will be stronger in the second half.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • WINT

    Premarket gainers: DSCO +41%. TRCR +39%. CIEN +9%. MAKO +10%. AEO +5%. CTIC +5%. NFLX +5%. RDN...

    Premarket gainers: DSCO +41%. TRCR +39%. CIEN +9%. MAKO +10%. AEO +5%. CTIC +5%. NFLX +5%. RDN +5%. NUAN +3%. ACH +3%. SINA +3%. DRYS +3%.
    Losers: P -26%. CSIQ -12%. ASTX -5%. AYR -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • DKS

    Sterne Agee chimes in with a mixed call on Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS), upgrading the...

    Sterne Agee chimes in with a mixed call on Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS), upgrading the company to Neutral from Underperform despite thinking that store productivity will decline. Analysts with Sterne admit they underestimated investors' appetite to buy into the DKS growth story. Shares +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
